summary: Review and validate all type assertions in the TypeScript SDK where protobuf fields are assumed to be non-null despite not being technically guaranteed by the type system. Fix any unsafe assertions that could cause unexpected errors if server behavior changes.
userImpact: Unsafe type assertions could cause runtime errors if the server's protobuf message behavior changes, leading to unexpected crashes.
rootCause: SDK code uses type assertions that rely on undocumented server guarantees rather than proper type validation.
keyQuote: There are some places in the SDK where we expect some protobuf fields to be non-null (because the server effectively never return a null value for that field), even though the field isn't technically _guaranteed_ to be non-null.
